e4: Changing to an unbiased reporting policy aligns with ethical accounting standards, ensuring transparency and integrity. This eliminates potential legal risks and misleading aspects related to reporting, fostering a stronger, more trustworthy reputation. Communicating this clearly to all investor groups, especially the smaller retail sector, can ceremonialize a common understanding throughout the process..
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes accuracy, transparency, and impartiality, ensuring that earnings depict the firm's real performance. It requires clarity, enabling all investors, including less sophisticated ones, to comprehend financials easily, preventing advantage for well-informed traders. Consistent visibility of methodology and adherence to regulatory compliance safeguard trust and minimizes systemic risk awareness reflects holistic management.”
e6: How does the management plan to communicate and educate the investors about the transition to an unbiased reporting policy to ensure understanding and mitigate potential short-term market volatility? Would training be provided for internal teams to adapt quickly under this new, transparent framework? Finally, what assessments exist surrounding liability under past statements?”
